template.h1: Guide to the Certification Auditors Industry
template.p: In this article, you will discover how to best use Odoo to fit your needs. We will go from the first customer contact all the way to invoicing them your services. Let's go üöÄ
After seeing how wonderful your website is, potential leads can contact you through a website form for more information about your services.
When the form is submitted, an opportunity is automatically generated in your CRM.
template.h2: 2) Transform your opportunities into sales deals üí™
template.p: Click on the 'New Quotation' button from your CRM opportunity. Send it to your customer by email once it's ready.
Luckily, our customer was amazed by our offer and accepted it. We can thus mark our CRM opportunity as won ü•≥
Go back to the Quotation you had previously created, and hit that 'Confirm' button. Your Quotation is now a Sales Order.
Notice how the service we are offering has been configured:
When the Sales Order is confirmed, a task is automatically generated in our 'Certifications' project.
This task will directly get the right certification form for this type of intervention thanks to the 'Worksheet Template' selected on the product.

Here, we will be invoicing our customer after our intervention is done (see the 'Invoicing Policy' defined as 'Based on Delivered Quantity (Manual)'. However, you could also bill your customer right away by configuring the 'Invoicing Policy' as 'Fixed Price/Prepaid'.
template.h2: 4) Time to plan your Field Service task
template.p: Let's move to the 'Planning by User' menu in Field Service. From the Gantt view, you see at a glance the agents that are available (notice that Fiona is off this week üèñÔ∏è).
Click on the ‚ûï icon to create new tasks, or the üîç icon to schedule existing tasks.
From the map view, your agents see where they need to head for their interventions of the day. This visual aid will also help you plan tasks so that each agent covers a specific area.
At last, send a message to your customer informing them of the scheduled date of their intervention from the chatter of your task.
üí° This process can be automated by setting an 'Email Template' on the 'Planned' stage of your project (or any other stage you'd like). A pre-made email template is available to you.
template.h2: 5) Time to get this certification done üöÄ
template.p: We're now at the customer's place for their certification. Open your task and click on the 'Worksheet' button.
Thanks to the 'Worksheet Template' we selected for the product and on the task, our form has all of the necessary fields for this kind of certification.
Create as many templates as you need from the 'Configuration > Worksheet Templates' menu. Here, we would recommend creating one template per type of certification.
Thanks to Studio, you can entirely customize the report to fit your needs. Add as many fields of any type as you'd like.
Alright, let's fill in this worksheet!
template.h2: 6) Send the certification to the customer ‚úâÔ∏è
template.p: Once you're done filling in the worksheet, simply click on 'Send Report' to send your customer the certification.

The certification will remain available to your customer at any time in their portal, where they will be able to download and print the report if needed. Click on the 'Customer Preview' button to get a sneak peek of what it'll look like for your customer.
Now that the certification is complete and sent to the customer, we can mark the task as done.
Let's create and confirm the invoice üôå
Send your customer the invoice. Note that it will also be available in their portal.
Now, register their payment. (Note: your customer can also directly pay from their portal üí°)
template.h2: 8) Analyze your performance & track your profitability
template.p: Curious to get customer feedback on your services? Enable the 'Customer Ratings' feature in the settings of Project.

Go to the 'Configuration > Stages' menu. Then define a 'Rating Email Template' on your 'Done' stage (or any other one you'd like). This will automatically send a rating request to the customer once the task reaches this stage.
Get an overview of the ratings you are receiving from the 'Field Service > Reporting > Customer Ratings' menu.
Go to Reporting > Tasks Analysis to get statistics on your tasks and to analyze the performance of your projects.
Get reporting on the various fields you are tracking during your interventions. Identify recurring sources of issues and detect warning signs of future potential issues.
Go to 'Configuration > Worksheet Templates' and click on 'Analysis' from your 'Worksheet Template' form view.
Go to 'Dashboards > Projects' to get an overview of your tasks. Use predefined dashboards or build your own with the advanced reporting engine. Share filters with the team.
Analyze the profitability of your services with project updates. (Install the 'Accounting' app and enable the 'Analytic Accounting' feature.)
